title: CI for Variance: Chi-squared Interval
contentHtml:
The chi-squared interval is a widely used method in statistical inference to construct an interval estimate of the population variance.

  • It's particularly useful when we're interested in making inferences about the spread of a distribution, rather than its central tendency.

subject: statistics
title: CI for Variance: Chi-squared Interval
contentHtml:
The chi-squared interval is a widely used method for constructing confidence intervals (CIs) for population variance.

Given a random sample of size n from a normal distribution with unknown mean and variance, the CI provides an estimate of the true population variance.
